abstract: Pera Museum in Istanbul hosts exhibit Bare, Naked, Nude: A Story of Modernization in Turkish Painting, which examines painting of nudes in Turkish culture; curator Ahu Antmen explains show is study on artistic genre, while others see collection of unclad male and female forms as challenge to country’s oppressive political and religious undertones.
lead_paragraph: At the Pera Museum in Istanbul a show examines how Turkish artists fought cultural restrictions a century ago in order to paint the nude figure.

headline.main: An Examination of the Nude Figure in Turkish Art at the Pera Museum
headline.print_headline: From Anatomical Studies of Men to Stylized Depictions of Women
